head.note: This manuscript contains: Portions of the Gospel of S. John, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Portions of the Gospel of S. John, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: Viz. ch. iii. 2—28, iv. 50—52, and v. 1—3.

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, about 5 in. by 4 1/8, all more or less stained and torn. There are 14 or 15 lines in each page. The handwriting is inelegant, of the xith or xiith cent.

item.p: All leaves are more or less stained and torn.

layout.p: There are 14 or 15 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is inelegant, of the 11th or 12th centuries.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

head.note: This manuscript contains: A portion of the first part of a Choir-book, comprising Psalms xlvi. 5—lx. 6, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A portion of the first part of a Choir-book, comprising Psalms xlvi. 5—lx. 6, according to the Peshitta version.
msItem.note: The Psalms are numbered, the ܡܪ̈ܡܝܬܐ and ܫܘ̈ܒܚܐ marked, and the versicles divided as usual by ܗ.

physDesc.p: Five vellum leaves, about 5 1/2 in. by 4 1/4, with from 17 to 19 lines in each page. The writing is rather inelegant, of the xiiith cent.

item.p: Five vellum leaves, about 5 1/2 in. by 4 1/4, with from 17 to 19 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is rather inelegant, of the xiiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of the Hymns of Severus; Part of the Hymns (ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܡ̈ܥܢܝܬܐ) of Severus. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 2 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns of Severus
msItem.note: Foll. 12 b and 13 a contain the hymns of Severus , but according to a different arrangement, which the scribe presently abandoned, commencing afresh on fol. 13 b.

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns of Severus
msItem.rubric: ܒܚܝ̣ܠ ܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܟܝ̇ܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܬܠܝܬ݂ܝ ܩ̈ܢܘܡܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܡܫ̇ܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬ݂ܘܒ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܡ̈ܥܢܝܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܣܐܘܝܪܐ ܦܐܛܪܝܐܪܟܐ ܕܐܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ. ܐܝܟ ܬ݁ܘܪܨܐ ܚ̣ܕܬܐ ܟܠ ܚܕܐ ܒܬܪ ܒܪܬ ܫܘܼܒܚܗ̇
msItem.note: Each hymn is accompanied by letters on the margin, indicating its number and the tone according to which it is chanted.

physDesc.p: Ten vellum leaves, about 6 in. by 3 7/8, forming the first quire of a neatly written manuscript of the xith cent., with ornamental devices (Add. 14,524 , foll. 12—21). There are from 20 to 24 lines in each page.

item.p: Ten vellum leaves, about 6 in. by 3 7/8, forming the first quire of a neatly written manuscript of the xith cent., (Add. 14,524, foll. 12—21). There are from 20 to 24 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: Neatly written, of the xith cent.

physDesc.p: Eight vellum leaves, about 5 3/8 in. by 3 3/4, the last two of which are slightly torn. They are written in a small and rather neat hand of the xith cent., with from 21 to 24 lines in each page

handDesc.handNote: They are written in a small and rather neat hand of the xith cent.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of the Hymns of Severus, etc.
The hymns for the Resurrection, arranged according to the eight tones
The hymns for S. Thomas and S. John the Evangelist

physDesc.p: Eighteen vellum leaves, about 5 1/8in. by 3 3/4, the last of which is much torn (Add. 14,524, foll. 30—47). The writing is of the xiiith cent., with from 13 to 18 lines in each page.

item.p: Eighteen vellum leaves, about 5 1/8in. by 3 3/4, the last of which is much torn (Add. 14,524, foll. 30—47), with from 13 to 18 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is of the xiiith cent.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

ADDED: added missing locus information for msItems
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
